context_bundle.summary: Message queue patterns for async agent communication and task distribution: Producer-Consumer (workers process tasks from queue), Pub/Sub (broadcast to subscribers), Priority Queue (high-priority first), Dead Letter Queue (failed messages). Platforms: RabbitMQ (AMQP), Redis (lists), Kafka (streaming), AWS SQS, Celery (Python tasks). Patterns: At-least-once, At-most-once, Exactly-once delivery. Use cases: background jobs, distributed tasks, event-driven workflows.

onboarding.quick_start: Message queues: Producer pushes tasks to queue, Consumer polls and processes. RabbitMQ: producer -> exchange -> queue -> consumer, AMQP protocol. Redis queues: LPUSH queue task, BRPOP queue 0 (blocking). Kafka: producer.send('topic', message), consumer.poll(). Celery (Python): @app.task decorator, task.delay() to enqueue. Patterns: FIFO (first-in-first-out), Priority (high priority first), DLQ (dead letter queue for failures). Delivery: At-least-once (may duplicate), At-most-once (may lose), Exactly-once (Kafka transactions). Use for: async jobs, distributed processing, decoupling services.
common_patterns: Redis queue: LPUSH queue task, BRPOP queue 0 (blocking pop)
Priority queue: each message has priority, high priority processed first
Dead Letter Queue: messages that fail N times -> DLQ for analysis
FIFO queue: strict ordering, one message at a time
At-least-once: ack after processing, may get duplicates if crash before ack
